title: Need help with ad removal
body:
Yeah lol this isn't the right forum or place to post this but i'm pretty lazy.

Everytime i go to a website this ad comes up ( http://imgur.com/QHyAksa ) and it's extremely annoying to wait for it to load ( which it rarely does load ) and having to wait the 30 seconds to skip. If anyone knows how to get rid of this, please post. Thanks

EDIT: I think it has something to do with Suprasavings or something similar

replies.body: Look through your chrome extensions, if there's anything you don't recognise then go into 'programs and features' in control panel and delete that sh!t (alternatively use system restore). Best to check in 'programs and features' for anything you don't recognise anyway (which it seems you are already doing). I don't know if it would work but you could try re-installing chrome. If all else fails you could try restoring your comp to factory settings (wiping everything other than what it came with) but I seriously doubt you'd want to do that.

I uninstalled a few programs and I think it worked. Thanks for the help everyone, and hell no to the computer reset haha. With this Australian internet it'd take a week just to get half my games back.

> [{quoted}](name=Gummyjacob,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=d7kVTAnc,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-01-03T07:01:06.475+0000)
>
> I uninstalled a few programs and I think it worked. 

ProTip: Dont Next>Next>Next>Next>Next> on things you download. Plenty of Nastys get onto your computer because you spam next on installers

Prime Example: Adobe Updates, they always try to package a 30day Norton/McAfee trial with every download which you need to opt out of.
CNET downloads, they always packages some form of Search Hi-Jacker.

Wish i could say

"THATS A TROJAN"
check ur task manager and usually it would be in there the name of the spam . then go to add remove and shes gone
Sounds like you got some Adware/Rougeware, What Anti-Virus do you use?
Any website? It could be a chrome extension that you unwittingly installed, but it may also be an annoying computer program. Check your extensions, and reset Chrome to default if you have to.
I've tried resetting chrome but it hasn't helped that much, although i'll try looking through my programs. Thanks!
